pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Wednesday, April 21, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

8:45 a.m. The Prime Minister, joined by the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance Chrystia Freeland and Minister of Families, Children and Social Development Ahmed Hussen, will join parents for a virtual discussion on child care. They will discuss experiences families have faced caring for children during the COVID-19 pandemic, and early learning and child care measures in Budget 2021 that will support families.

The opening remarks will be streamed live on the Prime Minister’s official Twitter account: https://twitter.com/CanadianPM.

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will virtually attend the National Caucus meeting.

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

Media appearances

5:20 p.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air live on Noovo Le Fil 17 with Noémi Mercier.

9:00 p.m.  An interview with the Prime Minister will air on Global News Hour at 6 BC.
